intro: Thermopsis orientalis, commonly known as the oriental goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia and parts of Europe. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in soft, glandular hairs. The plant produces bright yellow, pea-like flowers in raceme clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately compound, and have a distinctive, fern-like appearance. Thermopsis orientalis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
